rule = 'ENC'
message = None

def get_shifting_phrase(letter, alphabet_map):
    return alphabet_map[alphabet_map.find(letter) + 4 - 1]

def encrypt(message):
    plaintext = "".join(message.upper())
    if plaintext == '':
        return ''
    
    keyword = input('Input keyword: ')
    plaintext_alphabet = ['', space, key, letter, 
                         space, space, key, key, key] + plaintext
    alphabet_map = sorted('abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz') * 2
    reversed_alphabet = ''.join(reversed_alphabet)

    cdefency = []
    for i in alphabet_map:
        cdefency.extend([i for _ in range(plaintext_alphabet.find(i)+1)])
    cdefency.extend([keyword[-1]]+(keyword+keyword)[1:])

    reversed_alphabet = list(reversed_alphabet)
    for i in range(len(plaintext_alphabet)):
        plaintext_alphabet[i] = alphabet_map[plaintext_alphabet[i]]
    for i in range(len(plaintext_alphabet)):
        plaintext_alphabet[i] = get_shifting_phrase(
            plaintext_alphabet[i], cdefency) # continue shifting and investigating shifts
    cdefency = [i if ' ' in i else i for i in get_encryption_phrase(cdefency, reversed_alphabet)]
    for i in range(len(plaintext)):
        plaintext[i] = cdefency.index(plaintext[i])
    cdefency = cdefency[:-1]
    cdefency = [i if ' ' in i else i for i in cdefency]
    for i in range(len(plaintext)):
        plaintext[i] = cdefency.index(plaintext[i] + 4)
    s = ''.join(plaintext)
    return '' if s=='V' else '['+s+']'
    
def decrypt(message):
    plaintext = "".join(message.upper())
    if plaintext == '':
        return ''
    alphabet_map = sorted('abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz') * 2
    c = ''
    z = [c for c in sorted('abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz')]
    idx = 0
    for i in plaintext:
        if 'Z' in z or j<1:
            try:
                idx = z.index(i)
            except:
                idx = z.index(i)
        elif idx>z.index('Z'):
            idx = z.index('Z') + idx % (14 - idx) + idx + 9 % (14 - idx)
        else:
            idx = z.index('A') + idx % (13 - idx) + idx + 3 % (13 - idx)
        c = z[idx]
    s = ''.join(c)
    removeds = []
    for i in s:
        if i in ' []\'"`:
            removeds.append(i)
            c = s[:c].join(s[i+1:].split(i)[1:])
        else:
            break
    return removeds

## VPN Return Code

# Requirements

This project operates in the KITA [Virtual Private Network (VPN)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Virtual_private_network) application environment, published by KITA, and returns relevant error codes of VPN.

Please note the following strange facts about console logging:

```
print('This will always print.', end=" ")
print('because end default is ')
print('the next output will be appended directly to the end of the previous output')
print('but you can change this using end kwarg:')
print('for customs delimiter, exect ent = \n')
print('end = ', end = ', will appened the previous output to the next')
print('end by default is', endnow by default is')
print('end = ', end=') will print directly after the string')
print("How can you make a newline?")			# Write to the logger
logger.info("this will be printed directly on the python shell")
print("this will not print in python shell,but will print out when log file generates.")
```

# Tests ￼

Use cmake configure command mkdir build; cd build stage, and command ctest to execute the test. Note that all `print` statements are re-output when testing, ensuring that the test stubs for interactive testing are deleted.

# How to contribute

Just submit a patch! To start, sign up on [Github](https://github.com), fork the repository to your Github account. So now you can make tweaks and submit pull requests freely without worrying about accidents. After submitting a pull request, someone who maintains the repository will review it, and if all goes well, the pull request will be merged to the master branch.

If you want to become a contributor, you need to follow the general contribution process of the open source project and follow the contributor guide of each project.

The [contributor certificate of origin](https://help.github.com/articles/fetch-pull-request-certificate-of-origin/) for Github is required. To do this, you can add the following paragraph to your local `.gitconfig` file by running `git config --global commit.gpgSignFormat "brief"`:

```
[commit]
    gpgsign = True
[review]
     folding = true
[format]
    pretty = %ad-%an %an, %s, %b
```

### More Information:

- Vigenere Cipher Wikipedia: [Vigenere Cipher Article](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vigen%C3%A8re_cipher)

### Debugging the Algorithm To Ensure Proper Standard Algorithm

The standard algorithm outlined below will transform every pair letter in the faintly. That is to say, each alphabet of the ciphertext is a repeatable of each of the alphabets of the plaintext

- Each character of the plaintext will be used to pick a character form the key.
- The letter in the cipher will be the same as the character picked from the cipher.

### Here is the expected output:
```
PuzzlerCipher
Type: Encryption
Standard Plaintext:
PE
Standard Key:
KZ
Standard Ciphertext:
ZH
```

This is the standard input expected by the program. The program cannot be expected to answer mazing questions accurately if the algorithm is deviated from the expected standard above.

# Specifications:

### Encrypt Node: 

* encrypt_text: Function that will use the Vigenere cipher encryption theory to convert the plaintext message to ciphertext. It will iterate through the plaintext and the key.
  * Inputs: Plaintext and Key.
  * Outputs: Ciphertext we will use double square brackets ([]) to enclose the result of the ciphertext
* encrypt_message: Function that will use encrypt_text Function to encrypt a given plaintext.
  * Inputs: Plaintext.
  * Outputs: Ciphertext with double square brackets ([])

### Decrypt Node:
* decrypt_text: Function that will use the Vigenere cipher decryption theory to convert the given cipher text back to plaintext.
  * Inputs: Ciphertext
  * Outputs: Plaintext
* decrypt_message: Function that will use the decrypt_text Function/ Algorithm to decrypt the given cipher text
  * Inputs: Ciphertext
  * Outputs: Plaintext

My code is:
```py
def rotate_inner_disk(ip, cm, pd):
    inside = list(ip)
    inside.reverse()
    correspond = (dict().fromkeys(inside, 0))
    out = list(cm)
    out.reverse()
    i = 0
    while i < len(pd):
        j = i % len(out)
        correspond[in.pop()] = j
        i = (i + 1) % len(pd)
    return [sorted(["".join(zip(list(range(len(ip))), inside))) for i in correspond.values()][i % len(inside)][:i] for i in pd]


def cipher_evaluate(plaintext, period, increment):
    pl = ''.join(plaintext) + ' '
    dc = rotate_inner_disk(pl, "JKLZXCVBNMASDFGHJQWERTYUIO", [period] * len(pl))
    cir = (rotate_inner_disk(dc, 'QWERTYUIOPASDFGHJZXCVBNMKL', [increment] * len(dc)))
    return cir


def cipher_decrypt(ciphertext, period, increment):
    cc = minute_components([ciphertext] * len(ciphertext))
    ic = rotate_inner_disk(cc, 'JKLZXCVBNMASDFGHJQWERTYUIO', [period] * len(cc))
    dcc = (rotate_inner_disk(ic, 'QWERTYUIOPASDFGHJZXCVBNMKL', [increment] * len(ic)))
    return dcc


def rule_evaluation(str_input):
    plaintext = str_input[0:8]
    period = int(str_input[8])
    increment = int(str_input[9])
    c1 = cipher_evaluate(plaintext, period, increment)
    if c1 == "".join(str_input[9:]): return ["Plaintext: " + plaintext + ' ' + "Ciphertext: " + "".join(str_input[8:]) + ' ' + "Period: " + str(period) + ' ' + "Increment: " + str(increment)]
    c1 = ""
    cingle = cipher_decrypt(str_input, period, increment)
    if cingle == plaintext: return ["Ciphertext: " + "".join(str_input) + ' ' + "Decrypted: '".join(plaintext)+ ' ' + "Period: " + str(period) + ' ' + "Increment: " + str(increment)]

    return ["Plaintext: " + plaintext + ' ' + "Ciphertext: " + "".join(str_input) + ' ' + "Period: " + str(period) + ' ' + "Increment: " + str(increment)]
```

2. [File localization](https://github.com/python-pgg/DataLeak/blob/main/complete/file_detection.py)
3. [Cansassation](https://github.com/python-pgg/DataLeak/blob/main/complete/census.py) The code is incomplete and no satisfactory results have been obtained. This part needs to be revised.

For example, the format should be: [[decrypted answer]]. ### Answer: [[FORICASTOPEN>>REELEASE>>WEAK>>EMIS>CLANKING>>COMMAND>>REACT>>FUNNY>>NURSE>>FACE>>ORTHOGONAL>>PATTERN>>JOINS|>>ASSU>DIACCRIPT><>><>REPRESS>>OUTFITS>>LOW>>TOP>>EXCUSEWORDSWLSU!j?<>HIKB>><<2KE<<<>ATTRU>>>>>>JUNK!]] ## Analysis of the Extension The motivation behind using your own application is because I was having difficulty logging in to the usual website. This sandbox is a resource that I can log into when web limitations are present, but is also easy to create new ones for myself and/or have access to multiple projects. ## Screenshots ### Started properly After begging, I finally revealed this screen of a successful launch of the sandbox. ![Image of the extension screen](https://files.gitter.im/Plot-and-Craft/CodeSand.k2-fl-qKc/y6lenTo.png) ### Does not launch I'm not sure if there were any problems with internet connection, security systems, but I found this page to be unexpected but here. ![This image is here](https://me.me/i/once-i-had-a-cat-that-meowed-so-politely-actual-rootzooaoC.png) ### Start method I located the application page, it was a Rewards[…] and downloaded an unspecified extension. Once this was done, the extension was unpacked and I added it to an environment using the application CA tool. ![Page](https://res.ws/show/q0dk-515558.png) ![Page](https://res.ws/show/q0df-515560.png) ### Feedback to participants – Does the environment is easy to use? Can you operationalise the project? Yes, I found it easy to use and understand which parts involved when operationalising (through trial and error mostly). The only reason why this is not a 100% objective answer is because I was lost in the beginning as to the site's workings, but maintaining the secret agent was highly enjoyable. – Does the application requirements and operation guide are useful for the plan? Yes, they guided me with how to even launch the extension. They were surprisingly clear and straightforward to understand too. ## Future wishlist ideas - A simplified R or Python code section where you can refer to what you have in your secret agent (Sample: < script_code.rast: users.json). - For example: < script_code.rast: secret_agent.raw_users(users.json) - Ability to automatically remove line endings and hashes from your private project. - Automatically clean up any PowerView accessibility for a location of randomly choosing a variable into the rest of your markdown document. - For example, (*<(.*)3*=.*) would make yourself a hexadecimal the one line. - More extensions should be released for the program like there are some for Google Chromavaire and Firefox Discovering these extensions is one of the reasons why I want to learn JavaScript. I don't care if they are not useful for an extended period of time. - Option to keep a history of your executions, so you can view what everyone was up to in a day (even if they all clicked-/deleted). - Ability to customize your seal. - Ability to add your own files in a readme although they have 250B limit for a file, so the amount of custom-made project might not happen
Compare results on each sandbox with referecences on previous sandboxes No portions of results were compared.
